results.title: Muscle: chemistry of contraction
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
A brief resume of muscle histology, and sliding filament theory of muscle contraction. Emphasis shifts to chemical mechanism. The essential contractile element is actomyosin: ATP and calcium ions are also shown to be necessary. Experiments and simple models are used as illustrations. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Work of the kidneys. - 2nd. ed
results.creator_credit: Frank V Robinson, Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
Examines the importance of the kidneys as regulators of the body’s internal environment. Shows the functions of the kidney’s major parts and the relationships of these parts to each other as well as describing the physiological mechanisms by which the kidneys control the volume and composition of body fluids.

results.title: The Ears and hearing. [Rev. ed.]
results.creator_credit: Richard Barlow, Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
Structure and functions of the human ear and how it transmits sound waves to the brain. Discusses hearing malfunctions and records various stages of stapendectomy while the surgeon comments on the delicate procedures.

results.title: Fundamentals of the Nervous System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
Live photography, microphotography, animated drawings and medical demonstrations illustrate the functions, diversions and specific tasks of the nervous system. Shows how it conveys information from sense organs to brain, co-ordinates information with experience and directs muscles and other organs to carry out adaptive behaviour.

results.title: The Blood
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
Describes the circulation of the blood, its composition and its functions in supporting cell processes. Photomicrography, animation and demonstrations are used to show blood cell structure and locomotion, the formation of new blood cells, blood circulation and capillary structure and function. Also explains blood typing and the test for the Rh factor. Suitable for upper secondary levels.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.

Also explains blood typing and the test for the Rh factor. Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: Origin of land plants: liverworts and mosses
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 2. Plant life”.
Traces the evolution of land plants and illustrates the structural characteristics, reproductive processes and adaptive mechanisms of liverworts and mosses. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Joseph Stalin
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biography”.
Depicts the life of Stalin, under whose strong-arm rule the USSR became a world power. Explains Stalin’s part in making Russia a communist state. Commentary by Mike Wallace. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Mussolini
results.creator_credit: Burton Benjamin and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biography”.
Traces the life of Mussolini from his youth to the development of his own party and the Munich conference with Hitler. Shows his arrest and exile, capture and shooting. Introduced by Mussolini’s son and narrated by Walter Cronkite.
